@Huawei Fans Assistant D Hi, I come here for help again. My phone didn’t charge. What am I supposed to do? The charger worked normally with the lightning light on. But the battery percentage stayed the same. I dare not unplug the charger. I’m afraid my phone would be out of battery very quickly and would’t start up. I’m waiting online. It’s urgent.

Hi, under most circumstances, it’s because some apps are running while the phone is charging, or the system power consumption is high. It leads to the input electric current is not enough to counteract the electricity consumed by the phone. Thus, the electricity percentage stays the same, or even drops, instead of going high. Moreover, if the phone charges by connecting to the computer or the charger malfunctions, it also happens because computer USB outputs low and unstable electric currents.

If the output electric currents are too low, then the power consumed by the phone can’t be counteracted. Thus the electricity percentage won’t increase. Please avoid using the phone while charging. You can observe if your phone charges normally when you stop using the phone. We suggest you to charge your phone with the standard charger and avoid using USB or other equipment that outputs low electric currents to charge your phone. If you use standard charger to charge while your phone is on but the electric percentage won’t climb, You are suggested to turn off your phone while charging.

If your phone charges normally while it’s off, it may be caused by the quick power consumption of software, we suggest you to update your phone to the newest version, uninstall high power-consuming applications, clean application backstage before charging, or solve the problem by restoring factory settings. If your phone still doesn’t work normally with the standard charger and the phone off, it may be caused by the malfunction of charger. We suggest you to change a charger and try again.
